direction.raw_text: bursts into a clearing, breaks to the centre and stops.  With his pistol raised, he turns one full slow circle.  His eyes take in every swerve and kick of the wildly swaying trees. There's a crack and a branch snaps behind him.  He spins round, bellows deep from his heart:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God save the Queen!! And fires. Nothing happens.  The trees go on swaying, the storm goes on screaming and BROWN just stands there, staring into empty space.  A pause. Slowly, he starts to frown as the fact begins to dawn on him that he is alone.  He stares at the thrashing trees, waving their mocking arms at him.  His hand lets the pistol drop to his side.  He feels the rain drench down his face. And now, for the first time, we see that his socks have fallen to his ankles and his knees are cut to shreds.  He shifts a foot. direction.raw_text: And I intend to be there when she's ready. Silence.  The two of them stare at each other.

direction.raw_text: The next day, high and wide over the stunningly manicured landscape.  Long lawns, wind-cropped copses and in the distance, the glittering sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits side-saddle on a horse.  BROWN leads her in silence.

direction.raw_text: looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prince Albert was going to build a bench here.  He thought it one of the best views in Osborne.

direction.raw_text: He thought so, yes. She stares ahead.

direction.raw_text: In everything I do and everything I say, I try to think, as much as possible, what he would do, or say, if he were here now.  My Private Secretary wishes me to return to public duties-- She stops abruptly, but BROWN cuts in.

direction.raw_text: If Prince Albert were here today, he'd tell him a thing or two.

direction.raw_text: Sir Henry is not alone.  They all wish it. (beat) The same people who refused to grant my husband the title of King because he was deemed of insufficient rank-- She stops again, cutting quickly back to small-talk.

direction.raw_text: It is a fine spot for a bench, is it not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have some letters in the saddle bag. I wish to read them.

direction.raw_text: I cannot read them like that.

direction.raw_text: You will hand them to me as I require.

direction.raw_text: takes off the top letter and hands it to her.

direction.raw_text: The clatter and crush of the Upper Servant's table as UPPER SERVANTS sit themselves down to dinner while UNDER SERVANTS prepare to serve soup.

direction.raw_text: comes in and sits himself somewhere in the middle next to an empty seat.  A moment later, BROWN strides in. But instead of sitting at the place beside his brother, he goes straight to the head of the table and plonks himself down.  Slowly, the clatter dies away as the whole room stops and stares at him in silence.  BROWN fixes them with a look. An elderly butler steps into the room and stares in amazement at BROWN.  A smooth young man, BERTIE'S VALET, hurries up to intercede.

direction.raw_text: Mr. Carter, the Head Butler, sits there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not now he doesn't.  This is my place.

direction.raw_text: By whose authority?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My own. A little frisson of oh-my-gawdness.  BERTIE'S VALET stares icily at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The order of seating at the Upper Servant's table is arranged personally by the Queen herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a tautology lad. (unable to stop himself seriously explaining it) If you say the Queen arranges something, you've no need to say she's done it personally.  That's understood. But as far as BERTIE'S VALET is concerned, it isn't.  He stares down in mute fury, then snaps his fingers at one of the under servants, who rushes over.  There is a hurried exchange of whispers before the under servant rushes out. Unperturbed, BROWN brings out his flask and pours himself a substantial draft of whiskey.  He turns to the pretty assistant dresser, sitting to his right.

direction.raw_text: Are you dresser to Her Majesty? She blinks nervously at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assistant, sir, yes.

direction.raw_text: tucks into his soup.  Everyone watches and waits.

direction.raw_text: What's your name?

direction.raw_text: Mary Taylor, sir.

direction.raw_text: Have I seen you up in Balmoral, Mary?

direction.raw_text: I hope to go up next year.

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't happen to know what the Queen's reading for recreation, would you, Mary? The assistant dresser thinks for a moment.

direction.raw_text: Lord Tennyson, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods.  All conversation stops as the under servant bursts back in.  She halts at the door, looking blankly from Bertie's valet to the elderly butler.  A beat.  The old man stiffens and makes his way to the middle of the table.

direction.raw_text: looks up from his soup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I the only one eating? With a clatter of spoons, everyone obediently eats.

result.heading: DOCTOR JENNER, LADY ELY, LADY CHURCHILL,

direction.raw_text: A few days later.  A morning "drawing room."  Standing round the unlit fireplace are DOCTOR JENNER, LADY ELY, LADY CHURCHILL, the two LADIES IN WAITING and PRINCESS ALEXANDRA.  All are dressed against the icy wind that whistles through the open window where VICTORIA sits knitting busily while BERTIE stands beside her, coat buttoned up to the collar.  PONSONBY has stationed himself opposite, beside a desk piled high with red dispatch boxes. He runs through the daily itinerary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord Clarendon arrives, by invitation, at eleven o'clock, followed at twelve by a picnic in the grounds to celebrate Princess Alice's birthday. Dispatches, as usual, at two. (finishes, then coughs) The Chancellor writes to say that, by happy coincidence, he will be in Cowes for the weekend.  He asks if Your Majesty might grant him an audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thought, perhaps, Your Majesty might wish to be informed of the latest developments in government.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I shall be out walking. A beat.  BERTIE watches closely now.  PONSONBY coughs again, nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then perhaps Your Majesty might consider it opportune if the Prince of Wales were to meet him on your behalf?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stiffens.  She speaks without turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On no account.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives up.  Politely, but firmly, BERTIE takes up the reins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama, I really do think it's time we made ourselves a little more ... available.

direction.raw_text: carries on knitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we must accept our position in the country is not entirely unrelated to the continued absence of the Monarchy from public life. (silence) I thought perhaps we might consider a small gesture of some kind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks up sharply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gesture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought, a dinner for our ambassadors perhaps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No dinners, Bertie. (beat) Why are you dressed for outdoors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so infernally cold in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cold is good-- (calling across) Is that not so, Dr. Jenner?!

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cold is good!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent, ma'am, excellent. (trying his hand) But perhaps if her Majesty were to consider accompanying her new-found physical vigor with the benefits of mental activity...

direction.raw_text: Why am I being lectured in this way?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, Your Majesty.  In no way did I wish to suggest--

direction.raw_text: I will not tolerate anybody lecturing me about the responsibility of the monarchy....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Least of all my son.  It was his irresponsibility that drove my husband to his grave. An appalled silence.  With great dignity, BERTIE absorbs the shock of the insult and quietly steers the conversation in another direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it is inconvenient to Her Majesty, then perhaps she might consider allowing the Prince of Wales to host--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do believe they send so many boxes to taunt me. Doctor Jenner writes to them to say that my nerves are in an extremely fragile state and yet they continue to hound me with box after box after box after box after box! Silence.  VICTORIA has crossed to the window and stares out at the view.  Having recovered her composure, she turns to address them all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish to take the Princesses for a swim. For a moment, nobody believes what they have heard.  She continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The turns I have been taking in the grounds have proved most beneficial to me, and Brown thinks that salt water will do me good. Bertie stares at her in silence while PONSONBY and DOCTOR JENNER exchange a worried look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doors of the Royal bathing-machine swing open and Queen
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in a voluminous swim-dress, sails out like a duck into the freezing sea.  As she does so, the doors of the other machines open and Princess Helena and Princess Louise follow her in.  Dignity does not allow them to shout out, but their expressions of constipated agony are a picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins swimming around in a vigorous little circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't potter, children.  Swim. Hold for a moment on the princesses' miserable faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half an hour later, PONSONBY, DOCTOR JENNER, LADY ELY and two FOOTMEN watch as BROWN helps VICTORIA up some steps and onto her horse.  He glances at the stiff line of householders and mutters curtly to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could buy that lot for garden ornaments and still see change from ten guineas. The household do not hear this, but QUEEN VICTORIA has overheard and tries to suppress a smile. As she settles into the saddle, her foot comes loose. BROWN fastens it into the stirrups.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lift your foot, woman. Everyone hears this.  VICTORIA obeys.  Taking the reins, he then walks the QUEEN out of the courtyard.  As they vanish from site, we hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This nation is fortunate in so much as it is not governed by force...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "1866" FADE IN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The speech continues as we follow the progress of a Tomahawk cartoon doing the rounds of the Tory back benches from knee to knee.  It is entitled, "Where is Britannia?" and shows an empty throne draped with the Royal cloak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... but by a chain of traditions that have been cherished from generation to generation, because in them -- in our traditions -- are embodied all the laws which have enabled us to create the greatest empire of modern times... During the above, the cartoon reaches the front benches and lands on the knees of the young, earnest STANLEY.  As he frowns at the picture in front of him, DISRAELI winds up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... but, even though we have amassed great capital and even though we have established an industry with no parallel in the world, yet all these mighty creations are as nothing compared to the invisible customs that shape our lives.  To those honorable gentlemen of the opposition who seek to destroy the essential elements of this country, I say let them remember: England cannot begin again. During this peroration, we see DISRAELI for the first time. He is handsome, obviously Jewish and wire thin, like Dickens on Slimfast.  He dresses almost dandyishly but speaks with startling vigor; a combination of brilliance and cheek that is his key.  To cheers from his back benchers, he sits. As he looks up, he catches the eye of his opposite on the Liberal benches.  GLADSTONE is different in almost every respect; dour, dogged, heavy-set and tall.  They stare levelly for a second, then DISRAELI flashes a brilliant smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: plops the cartoon on his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few minutes later, DISRAELI and STANLEY are strolling down the busy lobby corridor.  Throughout their talk, Tory back-benchers bustle up to pat their hero on the back and offer their congratulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we take it seriously?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cartoon or Her Majesty's absenteeism?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question is, do we need her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely, you're not suggesting we dispense--

direction.raw_text: My dear Stanley, a Prime Minister with only a handful of friends must respect public opinion. The pass GLADSTONE in a huddle of cohorts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gossip counts.  Lord Aberdeen was right.  This country is not governed by wisdom but by talk. (beat) Granted, it wouldn't take much to winkle the old girl out of mourning, but if public opinion is against her, then it doesn't do to appear too close.

direction.raw_text: So?

direction.raw_text: We'll see which way the wind blows.

direction.raw_text: sweeps through a prattle of back-benchers.

direction.raw_text: is so creased up with laughing, he almost drowns.

direction.raw_text: One box of biscuits, one box of drop tablets, one box of pralines, sixteen chocolate sponges.  It's the same order every week, but does anybody bother to check it?  Now she has to travel all the way to Balmoral without the few luxuries she actually enjoys.

direction.raw_text: John, it's not your problem what she eats.

direction.raw_text: The woman's surrounded by fools! (beat) She has to be packed and ready to leave by seven thirty tomorrow morning.  Knowing that lot, they'll still be dressing her at eight.

direction.raw_text: takes a nip of whiskey and offers some to his brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's got an army of people to get her up and out.

direction.raw_text: stares at him.  A beat.

direction.raw_text: She'll blow hot and cold on you, John, she always does.  You want to be careful.

direction.raw_text: I'm on ninety pounds a year plus seventy pounds for a pile of tartan I'd be wearing anyway.  That's as much as a Page of the Back Stairs gets and that job's only for toffs. (raising his hip flask triumphantly at the sea) I'm Her Majesty's Highland Servant! Indoors and Out.  There's no stopping me now.

direction.raw_text: A few days later. The clatter of carriage and horse as the ROYAL PARTY thunders through gathering dark toward Balmoral Castle.

direction.raw_text: and STAFF swarm round the carriage, opening doors and clambering off boxes while a regiment of PIPERS play them in. Amid this swarm of activity, we glimpse BROWN opening the door to a smiling VICTORIA as she climbs down, followed by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just say what you have to say, woman. What other people think shouldn't matter to you.

direction.raw_text: Of course I shall say what I have to say.  I always do. The stare at each other until BROWN kicks his horse on.

direction.raw_text: Aye, well, if all you want is a good opinion then he'd be sure to oblige you.

direction.raw_text: What Mr Ponsonby was appreciating was their literary merit, a skill not intimately associated with the knowledge of grooming. (beat) Literary appreciation does not begin and end with Tennyson.

direction.raw_text: lowers his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mention you in them.

direction.raw_text: says nothing.

direction.raw_text: In particular, the occasion when Albert was alive; the Royal Carriage overturned during a storm and you demonstrated such loyal service in returning the Queen and the Princesses safely to Balmoral. Taking a sprig of heather from her brooch, VICTORIA holds it out to him.  A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For friendship.

direction.raw_text: A few days later, PONSONBY, DOCTOR JENNER and BROWN stand at the chamber-desk, talking over the Queen's itinerary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be away on Friday between eight o'clock and six in the evening to visit the Grants in Glasalt.  If she's to make the journey there and back in the day she's to have no distractions the night before.  She'll take a light supper alone in her private drawing room and retire early.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll need to sign dispatches before she retires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That can wait till the weekend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are important papers from -- BROWN It can wait.  Anything else?

direction.raw_text: Are you sure Her Majesty is up to such a long journey?  She has only just recovered from a severe head cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I thought she wasn't up to it, I wouldn't let her go, would I?

direction.raw_text: snaps together his papers and walks out, leaving
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and DOCTOR JENNER standing lamely at the table.

direction.raw_text: is in mid-plea.

direction.raw_text: Surely it is for the gentlemen to decide when to stop...

direction.raw_text: It is a disgusting habit, Bertie.  It should be discouraged.

direction.raw_text: Yes, but isn't midnight a little excessive?

direction.raw_text: It is quite late enough.

direction.raw_text: But mama, the room was built expressly for that purpose.  It has been a smoking-room by tradition ever since father -- VICTORIA (cutting in angrily) Brown's responsibilities are onerous enough already.  He has far too much to do without having to stay up all night waiting for you to go to bed. The smoking-room will be closed and the lights put out at twelve o'clock.

direction.raw_text: Mama...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that is my last word on the matter.

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm sorry, but I really do think it's too much that the gentlemen of the house should be dictated to by a servant.

direction.raw_text: stares back, too stunned to speak.  He glances at his mother, but VICTORIA looks off into the distance as if she has not heard.  BERTIE turns and storms away.

direction.raw_text: is standing in the doorway of a small cottage watching, with amused detachment, as a middle-aged couple,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MRS GRANT, race about their tiny living room, trying desperately to make it presentable for the Queen's sudden visit.  They fling open the windows, slosh water on the fire, tidy up their two grubby BOYS, plump up the cushions, dump knitting under the sofa and try to smarten themselves up, all in the space of a few seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's really no need for this.

direction.raw_text: I'll not have her seeing it like it is! (beat) I know she means well, but I wish she'd warn us she was coming.

direction.raw_text: Aye, well, you can't stop a wife being house-proud.

direction.raw_text: surveys the room critically.

direction.raw_text: All right. (beat) Show her in.

direction.raw_text: When are you gonna see it, John?  She doesn't give a damn about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lunges for the bedside drawer and pulls out a card showing a coy picture of a pretty woman.  He holds it up, eyes blazing.

direction.raw_text: From the Queen! He reads out the inscription.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My lips may give a message better of Christmas love than e'en this letter. (beat) To my best friend, J.B. from his best friend, V.R. (he thrusts it in his brother's face) Best friend!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She means it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll drop you.  When she's done with you, she'll drop you.

direction.raw_text: Get out. (beat) Out!

direction.raw_text: steps back but BROWN roars at him.

direction.raw_text: OUT!!

direction.raw_text: steps outside and BROWN is left alone.

direction.raw_text: The next day.  VICTORIA sits at her desk.  PONSONBY hands her letters to sign.

direction.raw_text: ... to be followed by a visit from Lady Bridport.  She is keen to secure a place for her niece as Maid of Honor.

direction.raw_text: signs the last letter and sits back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: coughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is one other matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a letter, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From whom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From Princess Helena and other members of your family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My family is quite capable of communicating with the Queen in person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: does not reply.  Finally, VICTORIA is obliged to ask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do they want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are demanding the dismissal of John Brown on grounds of drunkeness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares through the window, expressionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks through the ornate chapel, nervously fingering her handkerchief.  Waiting for her, smiling softly, is the Dean of Windsor, DEAN WELLSELLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wished to see me, ma'am? She holds his eyes for a moment, then nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few minutes later, VICTORIA and DEAN WELLSELLY are seated in a corner of the chapel, talking softly.  She cannot bring herself to look at him and so does not notice how carefully he is watching her throughout the interview. This is incredibly hard for her to say, but she struggles to be as honest as possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My husband tried always to make me think more subtly.  Of course he taught me so much and I can never repay my debt to him, or the love I feel, even now.  But, in truth, I think I am someone who can only feel things while they are alive to me. For that reason, I know I do not have a subtle mind.  I know that.  But I work hard and I try to do my duty. (she hesitates; she is struggling now) However, I have noticed of late that my feelings of grief are not so strong and -- that I find myself leaning more upon the comfort of living friends. (beat) Friends close to me now. She stops herself.  She is crying.  DEAN WELLSELLY watches her a moment, then speaks close, choosing his words carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Majesty, a settled resignation is more lasting proof of affection than active grief.  If the good Lord sees fit to bring one into contact with congenial fellow beings, one should not analyze one's reaction too deeply. To allow oneself to be comforted by someone else need not imply any disloyalty to the memory of the loved one. Silence.  VICTORIA stares into the long, dark chapel. Gradually, as she takes in the tone of his remarks, her disappointment turns to anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next day, VICTORIA stands at the far window and her back to the room.  Lined up against the wall are BERTIE and his siblings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Henry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please tell the Princess, and other signatories to this letter, that the Queen will not be dictated to, or made to alter, in any way, what she has found to answer for her comfort. (beat) Do I make myself clear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may go. They all file out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few days later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and VICTORIA are riding on horseback.  Although better than he was, BROWN'S face is still badly bruised. They turn a corner banked by trees.  BROWN is watching the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: closely.  She stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would like to get down. Without a word, BROWN dismounts and helps her off her horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was told you were in a fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has someone seen to those bruises?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Having considered my position here at court, I have come to the conclusion that it is in the best interest of Your Majesty that I should resign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not accept. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had foreseen that you would not. But Your Majesty should understand -- that my mind will not be changed in this.  I leave for Deeside -- VICTORIA (cutting in) The Queen forbids it. (beat) I cannot allow it because I cannot live without you.  Without you, I cannot find the strength to be who I must be.  Please. She takes his hand to her mouth and kisses it gently, then looks at him, utterly helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise me you won't let them send me back. A long silence.  BROWN holds her hand tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few weeks later. A tiny horse-drawn carriage creeps across a huge Highland landscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yesterday, Gladstone talked for three hours on the Irish Church Bill ... I am as guilty as the rest of underestimating his reforming zeal. Tory days may be numbered, but I fancy there yet remains one last hope of deliverance.  Wheresoever the blame lies, we must now close ranks and defend Mrs Brown's England.  As for my interminable journey to the land of Calvin, oatcakes and sulphur ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hurries through the pouring rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... no Prime Minister made greater sacrifice than attempting to run the country six hundred miles north of civilization. Reaching the castle, he hurries inside and the great doors bang behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is playing the piano like she walks, with great vim and vigor.  The tune is some quaint Scottish ballad which she belts out in her clear strong voice, almost drowning out PRINCE ARTHUR, PRINCE LOUISE and PRINCE LEOPOLD who are meant to be accompanying her.  They stand in a nervous semi-circle, fumbling their harmonies. Ignoring them completely, VICTORIA bobs up her head with a quizzical smile to make sure she is being appreciated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the rest of the HOUSEHOLD stand a few yards off, smiling rigidly.  DISRAELI, the consummate politician to his inch-high insteps, out-smiles the lot of them.  This man is in raptures of delight.  And the more liquid his smiles, the happier he makes VICTORIA.  He beams, she belts, until her children are drowned out completely. And then, with characteristic suddenness, VICTORIA stops playing and launches into one of her tirades.  The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wobbles in shock like children on a switch-back, but DISRAELI glides smoothly from delight to sober concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How dare the Irish break with the Anglicans? If Albert were alive today he would never allow the Crown to give up Church patronage.  No, the Irish must be told, very firmly, to stay exactly where they are.  It is the thin edge of the wedge, Mr Disraeli.  Next, you will be telling me that the Crown no longer governs this nation. A beat. A nervous silence in the Household.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Majesty remains at the very epicenter of governance.  As for your people, look no further than the sales of your Highland Journals to see in what affection the nation holds their Queen. (beat) You sell even more copies than Mr Dickens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I lack your prose, Mr Disraeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives him a tiny smile.  DISRAELI acknowledges it, then steers the conversation back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course I understand your concern. You miss your people. (a pause) And they miss you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: registers a slight flicker of defensiveness at the implied criticism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then they may read about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indeed, and for that they are eternally grateful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that not enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In so many ways ... and yet it is your presence they crave.  A figurehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has the measure of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never thought to be bullied by you, Mr Disraeli.  You, I thought, understood a widow's grief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, ma'am, I cannot speak for the nation, only for myself.  As Prime Minister I confess I miss your presence, but that is only an expression of my own selfish desires and I should not burden you with it. The Household waits.  Has he clawed himself back?  VICTORIA acknowledges his apology.  Her voice drops and she talks directly to DISRAELI, straight from the heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stay here because I am happy. (beat) Is that such a terrible crime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma'am. At this moment the far door opens and BROWN walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for your walk. Without a word, VICTORIA rises from her chair and starts following him out.  As they pass DISRAELI, she stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my good John Brown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have asked him to show you a little of Highland life while you are with us at Balmoral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: measures DISRAELI suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What brings you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man can refuse only so many invitations from his Queen.  It was remiss of me not to come earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles.  BROWN stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about the Highlands?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am a blank sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you hunt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Occasionally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dare say you can be taught.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To shoot perhaps, but not to kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you hunt, you kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: counters effortlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, I'll do my best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staying close to the ground we develop through a series of shots showing the other highlands -- sheet rain against heather and gorse, rivulets of water slashing through mud, crude pathways sliding in wind and all ball-breakingly cold. Coming up the hill, we begin to make out a hunting party. The sound first.  Like a small army, crashing their way up the winding path.  GHILLIES urging on their horses and dogs, guns and equipment jangling off pony-hacks an then the tall figure of JOHN BROWN striding out in front. Making no concession to anyone, he force-marches them up the hill, eyes on the hunt ahead. Behind them trot the men on horseback -- DISRAELI, PONSONBY, BERTIE and other
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: each led by GHILLIES and ATTENDANTS, among them
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Suddenly, BROWN stops and raises a hand.  The party halts. He listens for a second.  Satisfied that he has found his quarry, he brings his hand down and the party of gentlemen dismount as quietly as they can. As he waits, BROWN winces slightly from the pain in his side.  He pulls a flask of whiskey from his sporran and drinks.  All the time, DISRAELI keeps his eyes on BROWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stalking. Everyone is now fanned out along the hillside, a ghillie to each gentleman, slowly and silently moving up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stalks with BROWN, panting hard to keep up, eyes on his man, trying to make no sound. Suddenly, BROWN stops.  Very slowly he rises.  DISRAELI rides alongside and sees ... A huge stag staring majestically across the hillside. Keeping his movements smooth and slow, BROWN brings up his rifle, cocks it and offers DISRAELI the kill.  With a deferential gesture of the hands, DISRAELI declines.  BROWN stares at him a split-second, raises the rifle to his shoulder and fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kill. A rapid montage of guns firing, as we cut to ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sweeps in from the hunt, DISRAELI dripping at his side.

direction.raw_text: Always remember, you keep it tight to your shoulder, you absorb the kick. Aim for the head.  Then imagine it's Gladstone.

direction.raw_text: looks across at his brother but BROWN is hunched over his plate, pecking at his food. Someone titters and ARCHIE looks up.  BERTIE'S VALET coughs.  BROWN slowly lifts his head.  His eyes have the slightly unfocused look of too much drink.  It is clear to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that he is about to be sent-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see any Irish assassins today, Mr Brown? Brown doesn't react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We heard the dogs were Fenian sympathizers. Brown drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or was it the stag ...? Everyone bursts out laughing.  Brown slams down his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's not a soul here cares about that wee woman's safety except me! She'd die in a ditch if I wasn't there to look out for her -- He stops.  ARCHIE has come across to his brother's chair and pulls gently on his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at the SERVANTS.  Everyone is about to burst out laughing.  Keeping his dignity, he pushes back his chair and lets ARCHIE lead him away. As BROWN reaches the double doors, the laughter hits him in the back like a wave. ARCHIE holds him steady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is lying on a grubby bed.  ARCHIE is looking around the untidy room.  For the first time, he notices a thick manuscript on the table.  BROWN follows his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a diary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful who sees it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you take me for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns back to BROWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have someone look after you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm all right.  I just need to rest up a wee bit. (feeling everything spin) The room ... You don't have to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shuts his eyes and starts to drift.  ARCHIE watches over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is a mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't move to tidy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what the maids are for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not having some prattler going through my things. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Won't you give yourself a rest, John? She's other people to look out for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She needs me, Archie.  She canna do without me, she said it to my face. (his hands come up to cover his eyes) How can I stop now?

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is scrambling into his jacket as he hurries down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crashes out of a side-door -- just fully dressed -- to be met by the smiling figure of DISRAELI.  He is got up in smart walking boots, plus-fours and a tweed jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sent for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been called back to London.  My last day.  I thought I might take a walk on Lochnagar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares straight back.

direction.raw_text: An hour later, BROWN leads DISRAELI up the hill.  BROWN has his head down, on with the job.  DISRAELI slows to a halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Princes and Lords are but the breath of kings, An honest man's the noblest work of God. (beat) You must miss such magnificent views.

direction.raw_text: I don't think about it. They reach the top and continue along the high ground. DISRAELI glances at BROWN and notices the limp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, I've called you out and you should have been resting.

direction.raw_text: I'm fine.

direction.raw_text: You're injured.

direction.raw_text: I'm not married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.

direction.raw_text: This is the top.

direction.raw_text: admires the view for a moment, then continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I confess, I sometimes feel as if I am not married myself, I see my wife so little.  But I'm forgetting the rewards. He looks across.  BROWN keeps staring ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The look on their faces when one walks into the room.  Still gives one a ridiculous thrill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely -- BROWN (interrupts) What I do, I do for my Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was there never ambition?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe, once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I envy yo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To have achieved one's ambition, or to have reconciled oneself to its limits, is a lifetime's work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do what I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Her Majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But yourself? (beat) What about John Brown?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said. (beat) I serve the Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No other aspiration?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares for a long moment.  Finally he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To see her safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps a little closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will not be unaware of the threat now posed by Republicanism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you think I keep her here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, but therein lies the paradox.  It is her very isolation that encourages the malcontents.  The longer she is away, the stronger they become; and who, honestly, can promise security against that?  However many doors you lock, someone will always get in. Even here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches him, eyes alert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truth is, the Queen would be safer doing her duty and returning south to her public.  John Bull loves her and John Bull is her best defense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her mind is set.  She won't change now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She trusts you, John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is right on his shoulder now, like his own voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The threat. (beat) I tell them, but they don't see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They aren't as watchful as you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too busy looking after themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The greasy pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No loyalty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No love. Silence.  For a moment BROWN seems unaware that someone else has said that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promised to protect her from people like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For once in my life, I am not the issue.

direction.raw_text: She'll never understand it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In time, she will.

direction.raw_text: She'll think I betrayed her.

direction.raw_text: is rowing VICTORIA across the loch.  The EQUERRIES wait on the shore.

direction.raw_text: trails her hand in the water, frowning at the surface.  BROWN concentrates on the oars, slipping them carefully through the water. VICTORIA I received a letter today from Mr Disraeli.  Parliament is calling for my return to public duties. (beat) Why won't they let us be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: does not answer.

direction.raw_text: He insists that the country expects me to preside over the opening of the new session.  I refuse to offer sustenance to enable his weakening grip. Besides, you know how much I should hate it.  It frightens me. She notices that BROWN has said nothing.

direction.raw_text: John?

direction.raw_text: and BROWN are in the middle of a blazing row in front of the entire Household, including PONSONBY, JENNER and LADY ELY.

direction.raw_text: Duty?!  You talk about duty?!

direction.raw_text: If duty and safety are served by the same end then, aye, I do.

direction.raw_text: rounds on her, deeply wounded.

direction.raw_text: When I took you out riding, come rain or shine, because I knew it was right for you, when I kept the bairns off your back so you could have a bit of peace, when I saw you safe from home to home and you didn't even know I was there...!  All I've ever thought about is you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why send me back to them?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I have to! (pause Will you no listen to me, woman? Face turned from him, VICTORIA replies in a brittle voice.

direction.raw_text: Do not presume to talk to your Queen in that manner. A long silence.  BROWN watches her, but she will not look at him again.  Finally, she walks very slowly across the room.  She turns in the doorway, her voice faltering slightly.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few weeks later. Close on a door as it opens.  The ROYAL FAMILY are eating lunch with members of the UPPER HOUSEHOLD.  VICTORIA walks in with LADY ELY. A great scraping of chairs as everyone drops their forks and stands.  Clearly, they were not expecting her.  In silence, VICTORIA steps up and takes her place at the head of the table. At last, PONSONBY leans forward deferentially.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I say, how glad I am to see Your Majesty so much recovered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods, then turns and looks about at the others. PRINCESS ALEXANDRA is seated at the far end of the table. VICTORIA frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is my son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prince Albert is at Windsor, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is he not here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is sick, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are you not with him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ordered all members of the Royal Family to attend you at Balmoral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is the matter with him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has typhoid fever, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares blankly at DOCTOR JENNER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  You are mistaken.  Prince Albert, my husband, had typhoid fever.  I asked what was wrong with my son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same, your Majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops.  She stares down the length of the table. A long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why was I not informed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did not consider it wise, in the circumstances, to tax your nerves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ill is he? No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is not well, ma'am. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must go to him. Suddenly, VICTORIA stands.  Chairs bang back as everyone leaps to their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must leave at once. Abruptly, VICTORIA turns for the door and the room erupts into activity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands in the corridor, a little nonplussed by the servants and Householders hurrying about in every direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half an hour later, BROWN races up to the Queen's carriage amid a swarm of servants, ladies' maids and Householders rushing to be ready in time. Suddenly the huge castle doors open and VICTORIA bustles out with her entourage in tow.  BROWN -- only just in time - yanks open the door for VICTORIA to step past him and take her place.  She ignores him completely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slams the doors.  As he looks up, he sees his brother
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staring at him from across the courtyard.  For a second the two brothers hold each other's gaze.  It's obvious that ARCHIE has noticed the Queen's indifference. BROWN turns away and mounts the box as the carriage races away under him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some days later.  A tableau.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits at the foot of the bed, a matriarch surrounded by her ROYAL FAMILY.  They watch DOCTOR JENNER bend to examine the ghostly figure of BERTIE.  He listens for a pulse.  Finally, he looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lets out a deep breath.  She takes hold of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should the good Lord see fit to spare my son, I will order a mass to be celebrated at St. George's.  The people must share with their Queen, her prayers and hopes for their future King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few minutes later, BROWN stands in the corridor when the door bursts open and VICTORIA marches straight past him with PONSONBY at her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Queen will be riding to St. George's on the fifth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I recommend Her Majesty uses the covered carriage with a full Horse Guard.  In the event of any disturbance I will ensure -- VICTORIA (cutting in) I will ride to St. George's in an open carriage.  It is time the Queen was seen by her public.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns and disappears down the corridor, followed by PONSONBY.  We linger on BROWN'S humiliation, closer and closer until ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GEORGE'S - DAY Some weeks later. A series of angles on BROWN as he walks amid the mass of onlookers pressing against a cordon of guards surrounding the cathedral.  All the time, his eyes flick left and right, searching the faces in front of him for potential assassins.  Over his intense watchfulness we hear ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... praise and magnify thy glorious name for that thou has raised thy servant Albert Edward, Prince of Wales from the bed of sickness. We pray thee to perfect the recovery of thy servant and to crown him day by day with more abundant blessings both for body and soul, through Jesus Christ our Lord ... The CONGREGATION mutters a vast ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GEORGE'S - DAY VICTORIA and other members of the ROYAL FAMILY walk down the steps towards the cheering crowd.  As DEAN WELLSELLY and BROWN follow, BROWN sees ARTHUR O'CONNER break from the onlookers, pulling out a gun.  BROWN yells out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! He races toward O'CONNER and hits him flying, bangs him to the ground and twists the gun out of his hand.  As they fall we hear laughter and:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there he is, Arthur O'Conner...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: QUEEN VICTORIA, PRINCESS ALEXANDRA, PRINCESS LOUISE

direction.raw_text: It's a few days later and BERTIE is entertaining a private dinner party.  They include QUEEN VICTORIA, PRINCESS ALEXANDRA, PRINCESS LOUISE and HENRY PONSONBY.  BROWN is in attendance.  He stands off to one side, near the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... all seven stone of the man, paddling madly towards us through a sea of Horse Guards, waving something that looks vaguely like a pen.  I thought he must be one of the mother's ardent readership in search of the Royal indenture... More chortling.  VICTORIA watches her son, smiling proudly. BROWN looks straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe I saw him first and then alerted Brown.  I'm not convinced that he wasn't taking a snooze on top of the box.  Anyway, we had our man pinned down and I must say, Brown acquitted himself admirably.  Of course the gun was a fake, but all the same, it was well done. No-one registers BROWN.  But while VICTORIA does not look at him, she is acutely aware of his presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I intend Brown to be rewarded with a special medal cast in gold.  It will be called The Devoted Service Medal. The guests applaud politely.  BERTIE clinks his glass for attention and raises it high.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A toast.  Victoria Regina! The others raise their glasses in unison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victoria Regina!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles.  BROWN remains alone by the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The people of England have expressed in a manner which cannot be mistaken, that they will uphold the ancient monarchy of England ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is delivering his come-back speech at a banquet of Tory delegates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... If the first great object of the Tory Party is to maintain the institutions of the country, the second is, in my opinion, to maintain the Empire of England ... the hereditary, the traditionary policy of the Tory Party.  Go to your homes, teach them these truths, which will soon be imprinted on the conscience of the land ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : "1883" FADE IN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound of rain driven hard against a window.  We creep slowly down the corridor until we are back with the fifty year-old BROWN.  With his whiskey for company, he is sitting at his desk, writing in the diary. The diary-manuscript is now falling apart with wear, but there remain a few blank pages.  Slowly, he fills them in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should not live in expectation of contentment.  Fifteen years of vigilance will not guarantee peace of mind.  Yesterday, intruders were again reported in the South Wing.  I believe my prompt arrival may have averted any crisis, but it was a timely reminder. It is a great comfort to me that my efforts in securing the Queen's safety over the years have not been in vain. Certainly Her Majesty sends me no word that she's dissatisfied.  And I feel sure that if she were unhappy she would have found the occasion  to speak to me in person, as she has so often done in the past. A knock at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? We hear a young PAGE, breathless from running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: North woods, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grabs his gun and rushes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears at the door and strides into the storm.  He walks quickly across the wide quadrangle, rain soaking his hair and clothes. Two GUARDS watch BROWN as he races out into the storm. A coin flips through the air to be caught by an outstretched hand.  The second GUARD grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: races across the open ground towards the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now we are back with the opening sequence.  Truncated, severe, and shot from a slightly different angle.  The driving rain, BROWN hurtling through the trees, the crack to his left, he spins and plunges on.
direction.name: direction

location: THE GROUNDS OF WINDSOR CASTLE, FOREST
result.heading: EXT.

direction.raw_text: Close-up on BROWN as he bangs against a tree, heaving for air.  He searches the dark, stops, listens and races on.
direction.name: direction

location: THE GROUNDS OF WINDSOR CASTLE, FOREST
result.heading: EXT.

direction.raw_text: tears through the trees, pistol raised at full arm's length.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: THE GROUNDS OF WINDSOR CASTLE, FOREST

direction.raw_text: He bursts into a clearing, breaks to the centre and stops. Pistol raised, he turns a circle, eyes on the wildly swaying trees.  A branch snaps behind him.  He spins round, bellows deep from his heart:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God save the Queen!! And fires.
direction.name: direction

location: THE GROUNDS OF WINDSOR CASTLE, FOREST
result.heading: EXT.

direction.raw_text: A few days later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is moving swiftly down a long corridor with LADY ELY.  They arrive at a door.  VICTORIA stands facing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long has he been this sick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few days, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why was I not told earlier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doesn't answer.  VICTORIA knows anyway.  She nods. LADY ELY knocks.  The door is opened by a young UNDER SERVANT who gawps at the sight of Her Majesty standing here in the servant's quarters.  VICTORIA walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room has been cleared of bottles, but the thinness of the life here shocks her deeply.  The cheap furniture, the anonymous prints, the bed and, finally, the sight of BROWN. He is lying in bed, barely conscious.  After a moment, he opens his eyes and stares at her.  She steps forward, smiling nervously. Her voice is the old voice, between friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should never have gone out in such foul weather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone has to look after you. (pause) It could've been someone.  It was before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Yes it was. He cannot speak.  It's difficult for her too, but she speaks for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Ministers are as impertinent as ever.  Dispatches are now so numerous, they come in a trunk.  Sometimes I do believe they will never stop.  Endless letters... Her voice falters.  A pause
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I have not always been the loyal friend you deserved, John.  And yet here I am now, even now, feeling desperate at the thought of losing you. She starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be silly, woman. His old, familiar gruffness makes her smile and she pulls herself together.  Seeing a bowl of water on the side table, she steps across.  Carefully folding a cloth in four, she rinses it in the water and gently wipes his face. Leaning closer, she is about to touch his face when BROWN gestures protectively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not too near.
direction.name: direction
